SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.options

Class ArgumentsParserBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.options.ArgumentsParserBuilder
public class ArgumentsParserBuilder extends Object
The ArgumentsParserBuilder class is used to construct an instance of ArgumentsParser with the desired configuration.

    • positionalArgs

      public ArgumentsParserBuilder positionalArgs(int minArgs, int maxArgs, String... argDisplayNames)
      Sets the range and display name for the positional arguments.
      Parameters:
      minArgs - the minimum number of positional arguments
      maxArgs - the maximum number of positional arguments
      argDisplayNames - the display names for the positional arguments
      Returns:
      the ArgumentsParserBuilder instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the minArgs is less than 0, maxArgs is less than 0, or minArgs is greater than maxArgs

    • positionalArgs

      Parameters:
      minArgs - the minimum number of positional arguments
      maxArgs - the maximum number of positional arguments
      Returns:
      the ArgumentsParserBuilder instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the minArgs is less than 0, maxArgs is less than 0, or minArgs is greater than maxArgs

    • flagBuilder

      public FlagBuilder flagBuilder(String displayName, String description)
      Creates a new FlagBuilder that will add the created flag to this builder when its build() method is called.

      A flag is a boolean option that can either be present (true) or absent (false) in the arguments.

      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the flag
      description - the description of the flag, providing details about its purpose
      Returns:
      a FlagBuilder instance for further configuration of the flag

    • optionBuilder

      public <T> OptionBuilder<T> optionBuilder(String displayName, String description, Class<T> targetType)
      Creates a new OptionBuilder that will add the created flag to this builder when its build() method is called.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value the option will accept
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the option, used for identification during argument parsing
      description - the description of the option, providing details about its purpose
      targetType - the type of value the option will handle or accept
      Returns:
      an OptionBuilder instance for further configuration of the option

    • addFlag

      public Option<Boolean> addFlag(String displayName, String description, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Adds a flag option to the ArgumentsParserBuilder with a specified display name, description, and switches. A flag is a boolean option that is either true (when the flag switch is present) or false (when it is absent).
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the flag, used for identification and help documentation
      description - the description of the flag, providing details about its purpose
      firstSwitch - the primary switch used to enable this flag (e.g., "--flag")
      moreSwitches - additional switches that can also be used to enable this flag
      Returns:
      an Option<Boolean> instance representing the flag

    • addStringOption

      public Option<String> addStringOption(String displayName, String description, Repetitions repetitions, String argName, Supplier<@Nullable String> defaultSupplier, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Adds a string-based option to the ArgumentsParserBuilder with various configuration options.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the option, used for identification during argument parsing
      description - the description of the option, providing details about its purpose
      repetitions - specifies how many times the option can or must occur (e.g., REQUIRED, OPTIONAL, etc.)
      argName - the name of the argument that will appear in usage or help messages
      defaultSupplier - a supplier that provides a default value for the option when it is not explicitly specified
      firstSwitch - the primary flag or switch associated with this option (e.g., "--option")
      moreSwitches - additional flags or switches that can also trigger this option
      Returns:
      an Option<String> instance representing the configured string-based option

    • addIntegerOption

      public Option<Integer> addIntegerOption(String displayName, String description, Repetitions repetitions, String argName, Supplier<@Nullable Integer> defaultSupplier, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Adds an integer option to the ArgumentsParserBuilder with specified configuration options.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the option, which is used for identification and displayed in help documentation
      description - the description of the option, providing details about its purpose
      repetitions - specifies how many times the option can or must occur (e.g., REQUIRED, OPTIONAL, etc.)
      argName - the name of the argument that will appear in usage or help messages
      defaultSupplier - a supplier that provides a default value for the option when it is not explicitly specified; can be null
      firstSwitch - the primary switch or flag associated with this option (e.g., "--option")
      moreSwitches - additional switches or flags that can also trigger this option
      Returns:
      an Option<Integer> instance representing the configured integer-based option

    • addPathOption

      public Option<Path> addPathOption(String displayName, String description, Repetitions repetitions, String argName, Supplier<@Nullable Path> defaultSupplier, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Adds a Path-based option to the ArgumentsParserBuilder with the specified configuration.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the option, used for identification and displayed in help documentation
      description - the description of the option, providing details about its purpose
      repetitions - specifies how many times the option can or must occur (e.g., REQUIRED, OPTIONAL, etc.)
      argName - the name of the argument that will appear in usage or help messages
      defaultSupplier - a supplier that provides a default value for the option when it is not explicitly specified; can be null
      firstSwitch - the primary switch or flag associated with this option (e.g., "--option")
      moreSwitches - additional switches or flags that can also trigger this option
      Returns:
      an Option<Path> instance representing the configured Path-based option

    • addUriOption

      public Option<URI> addUriOption(String displayName, String description, Repetitions repetitions, String argName, Supplier<@Nullable URI> defaultSupplier, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Adds a new URI option to the configuration.
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the option
      description - a brief description of what the option does
      repetitions - the repetitions constraint for the option
      argName - the name of the argument representing the URI
      defaultSupplier - a supplier that provides a default URI value, can be null
      firstSwitch - the primary switch for the option
      moreSwitches - additional switches for the option
      Returns:
      an Option<URI> representing the configured URI option

    • addEnumOption

      public <T extends Enum<T>> Option<@Nullable T> addEnumOption(String displayName, String description, Repetitions repetitions, String argName, Supplier<@Nullable T> defaultSupplier, Class<T> targetClass, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Adds an enumerated option to the current context.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the enum, extending Enum
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the option
      description - the description of the option
      repetitions - the number of times the option can or must be specified
      argName - the argument name expected for the option
      defaultSupplier - a supplier providing the default enum value if none is specified
      targetClass - the enum class representing the possible values
      firstSwitch - the primary switch for the option
      moreSwitches - additional switches for the option
      Returns:
      an Option object representing the added enumerated option

    • addObjectOption

      public <T> Option<T> addObjectOption(String displayName, String description, Repetitions repetitions, String argName, Supplier<@Nullable T> defaultSupplier, Class<T> targetClass, Converter<String,T> converter, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Adds an object option to be parsed with specific parameters and switches. This method allows setting a display name, description, argument name, default value, type, and converter for the option. It also specifies the first switch and additional switches associated with this option.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resulting option value
      Parameters:
      displayName - the name displayed for the option in usage or help output
      description - a brief explanation of the purpose of the option
      repetitions - the number of times the option may appear or is required; it determines if the option is mandatory or optional
      argName - the name used to indicate the argument for the option
      defaultSupplier - a supplier that provides a default value if the option is not specified; null indicates no default value is provided
      targetClass - the class type of the option's target value
      converter - a converter function used to transform the string argument into the target type
      firstSwitch - the primary switch that triggers this option
      moreSwitches - additional switches that can also be used to trigger this option
      Returns:
      an Option object representing the configured option with the specified parameters and switches

    • addRecordOption

      public <T extends Record> Option<@Nullable T> addRecordOption(String displayName, String description, Repetitions repetitions, Supplier<@Nullable T> defaultSupplier, Class<T> targetClass, String firstSwitch, String... moreSwitches)
      Adds a new record option with the specified configuration parameters. This method dynamically constructs an option based on the components defined in the target record class. Each record component is mapped to a parameter that can be supplied when using the option.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the record
      Parameters:
      displayName - the display name of the option
      description - a description explaining the purpose of the option
      repetitions - the number of times the option can be specified
      defaultSupplier - a supplier of the default value for the record instance
      targetClass - the class representing the record type
      firstSwitch - the primary command-line switch associated with this option
      moreSwitches - additional command-line switches associated with this option
      Returns:
      an Option representing the configured option for the specified record type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a record component's type is unsupported

    • addOption

      public <O extends Option<?>> O addOption(O option)
      Adds an option to the ArgumentsParserBuilder instance being built.
      Type Parameters:
      O - the type of option to be added
      Parameters:
      option - the option to be added
      Returns:
      the added option

    • build

      public ArgumentsParser build(Option<?>... validationOverridingOptions)
      Builds the parser and returns a new instance of ArgumentsParser.
      Parameters:
      validationOverridingOptions - options that inhibit validation if present on the command line
      Returns:
      a new instance of ArgumentsParser
